intro: Endresiella zahlbruckneriana, commonly known as the Zahler's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
